The Elder Umāpupphi’s Birth Story
“I saw the supreme man,🔽the perfected one, the undefeated one,
the one who has attained concentration,
sitting in concentration.
I took a flower of the umā plant
and offered it to the Buddha.
All the flowers had a single head,
with the stalk above and the petals below.
They stood there as if well-arranged,
a canopy of flowers in the sky.
Through that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in the Tusita heaven.
For ninety-four eons,
I made an offering of a flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For fifty-five eons,
I was a lord of the land.
I was called Samantapāsādika,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
and the six super-knowledges were realized.
I have done what had to be done for the Buddha’s teaching.”🔽Thus the elder Umāpupphi recited these verses.
